summary: SEAT BELTS WON'T RETRACT.  IGNITION SWITCH IS FAULTY AND SHORTING OUT RADIO AND OTHER ELECTRICAL COMPONENTS.  WANTING TO PREVENT FIRE FROM HAPPENING, BY TAKING CARE OF THIS NOW.

THE IGNITION SWITCH GIVES SPARKS AND COULD IGNITE THE CAR. FORD ADMITS OTHER 1988 LINCOLN TOWN CARS HAVE A IGNITION SWITCH PROBLEM AND REPLACES THEM. THEY HAVE NOT INCLUDED MY VIN ON THE DEFECT AND REPLACEMENT LIST; HOWEVER, IT IS DEFECTIVE AND COULD IGNITE A FIRE AT ANY TIME.  *TR
THE TRANSMISSION SUDDENLY FAILS WHEN IN OVERDRIVE.  THIS FAILURE OCCURS ON THE HIGHWAY AT HIGH SPEED AND COULD CAUSE AN ACCIDENT BECAUSE THE CAR GOES OUT OF CONTROL.  *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1988 LINCOLN TOWNCAR. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 25 MPH, THE CLIP FROM THE THROTTLE BODY FRACTURED AND ACCELERATED THE VEHICLE TO 80 MPH. THE CONTACT WAS ABLE TO STOP THE VEHICLE BY REMOVING THE KEY FROM THE IGNITION. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO A DEALER WHO INFORMED THE CONTACT THAT HE NEEDED TO REPLACE THE THROTTLE BODY CLIP. THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 85,000.  THE TRANSMISSION SELECTOR CABLE HAD TO REPLACED. UPDATED 04/25/11

1988 LINCOLN TOWNCAR. CONSUMER STATES BUSINESS SOLD FAULTY CAR PARTS RELATED TO A SAFETY DEFECT *TGW  THE CONSUMER WAS ADVISED BY HIS LOCAL MECHANIC THAT THE ORIGINAL UPPER BALL JOINTS HAD A TORN BOOT AND HE COULD NO LONGER GREASE IT. THE MECHANIC ALSO SUGGESTED REPLACING THE LOWER BALL JOINTS AS WELL. THE CONSUMER THEN ORDERED LOWER AND UPPER BALL JOINTS FROM AN ESTABLISHMENT AND HAD HIS LOCAL MECHANIC INSTALL THEM.  ON MARCH 5, 2010, AS THE CONSUMER STOPPED AT AN INTERSECTION, HE HEARD A LOUD NOISE AT WHICH TIME THE RIGHT FRONT LOWER BALL JOINT FAILED AND THE RIGHT FRONT WHEEL JAMMED BACK INTO THE FENDER WELL. THE COMPANY REPLACED THE BALL JOINT, BUT WOULD NOT TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE OTHER EXPENSES THE CONSUMER INCURRED. *JB
THE LINCOLN TOWN CAR WAS PARKED OUTSIDE A RENTAL HOME AND CAUGHT FIRE. *TR

DT*:  THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING 45 MPH, THE VEHICLE SLIPPED OUT OF GEAR, ACCOMPANIED BY A SMELL OF HOT OIL.  THE VEHICLE WAS PULLED OVER TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD AND THEN TAKEN TO A PRIVATE MECHANIC SHOP WHERE THE SHOP WAS UNABLE TO DETERMINE THE CAUSE OF THE PROBLEM.

NOTICED A STRONG ODOR OF GASOLINE. I CHECKED UNDER THE CAR AND NOTICED A STEADY DRIP OF GASOLINE FROM SOMEWHERE RIGHT BELOW THE CAR UNDERNEAT THE DRIVER'S SIDE SEAR, DRIPPING OFF THE FRAME OF THE CAR IN THAT AREA.
WHILE APPLYING THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL WENT DOWN TO THE FLOOR.  DRIVER WAS ABLE TO CONTROL THE VEHICLE. *AK

FUEL SYSTEM: ELECTRIC RELAY TO FUEL PUMP FAILED 6/21/02--CAR HAD TO BE TOWED FOR REPAIR  POWER WINDOWS: DRIVER'S SIDE WINDOW MOTOR FAILED. WAS REPLACED IN FALL 2000 BY DEALER IN SEATTLE: "OLYMPIC LINCOLN MERCURY." PRESENTLY, SAME MOTOR FAILING AGAIN. ALSO, REAR PASSENGER WINDOW GEARS HAVE STRIPPED OUT--WINDOW MUST BE MANUALLY PULLED UP IF MISTAKENLY OPENED  SUDDEN STALLING (APRIL 2002 TO PRESENT): HAD TO FIND ON INTERNET THAT "DISTRIBUTOR MODULE" WAS OVERHEATING AND CAUSING CAR TO STALL (ALL POWER LOST: NO STEERING, ONE PUSH ON BRAKES--I WAS ENDANGERED) NOTICE FROM FORD, THOUGHT THEY KNOW THAT THIS WAS HAPPENING AND FATALITIES HAD BEEN REPORTED. (THERE WAS A SERVICE BULLETIN TO REPAIR SHOPS ABOUT IT, BUT NOT TO CONSUMERS.) I WAS STRANDED 3 TIMES, HAVING TO ABANDON THE CAR, THEN HAVE IT TOWED TWICE FOR REPAIRS. NEW "MODULE" SEEMED TO HAVE RESOLVED ISSUE--READ ON. OCT 15, 2002: CAR QUIT SUDDENLY, AT IDLE, WHEN STOPPED IN TURN LANE, WAITING TO TURN ACROSS DANGEROUS HIGHWAY. WOULD NOT START--HAD TO BE TOWED. NOV 27/02: ELECTRICAL ISSUES NIGHTLY DRAINING 1 WEEK OLD BATTERY. CAR HAS BEEN GONE OVER BY ELECTRICAL SPECIALIST,  ANOTHER REPAIR SHOP, ALSO THE LOCAL FORD AGENCY--"NO CODES," BUT PROBLEM PERSISTS. CAR DEAD AGAIN TODAY AFTER RETURNING FROM REPAIR SHOP YESTERDAY.  WHAT TO DO? WHAT TO DO? CAR HAS 115,000 MILES AND HAS BEEN EXCELLENTLY MAINTAINED. EXCELLENTLY!

THE RELAY THAT HOOKS TO THE BATTERY STARTER] BROKE. THIS CAUSED VEHICLE TO ACCLELERATE IN FULL THROTTLE.  CONSUMER CAME TO A COMPLETED STOP, BUT HAD TO DISCONNECT THE BATTERY TO STOP THE ENGINE FROM RUNNING, ALTHOUGH THE VEHICLE WAS TURNED OFF. RELAY # 1E9TZ-11450B.*AK

I WOULD BE TRAVELING DOWN THE HIGHWAY AT 60WITH MY FAMILY AND MY CAR WOULD SHUT OFF. I WOULD THEN PULL TO THE SIDE AND LET IT SIT FOR 20 MINUTES AND THEN IT WOULD RESTART UNTIL IT HAPPENS AGAIN ''VERY DANGEROUS''. *AK

VEHICLE WILL STALL SUDDENDLY WHEN THE ENGINE GETS HOT.  VEHICLE WILL RESTART, BUT IT HAS STALLED LEAVING CONSUMER IN DANGEROUS SITUATION. *AK  THE DISTRIBUTOR MOUNTED TFHV MODULE IS TOO CLOSE TO THE HOT ENGINE. THIS CAUSES THE VEHICLE TO STALL.  *YH

THIS IS MY SECOND REPORT ON THESE TIRES.   SEE ODI NUMBER 731196 FOR FAILURE REPORT ON BOTH FRONT TIRES.  THIS REPORT IS ON THE REAR RIGHT TIRE.  THE RIGHT REAR TIRE FAILED CATASTROPHICALLY AT 60MPH WHILE I WAS DRIVING ON A SMOOTH DRY PAVEMENT.  THE OUTER SIDE WALL FAILED COMPLETELY.  DIGITAL PHOTOS OF THE FAILED TIRE ARE AVAILABLE.  THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION WAS LOCATED ON THE INSIDE OR BLACKWALL SIDE OF THE TIRES: 85288 IN RAISED LETTERS AND 8H2298 IN A RECESSED BOX WITH ROUNDED CORNERS.   IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS OR REQUIRE ADDITIONAL INFORMATION, PLEASE WRITE, CALL OR EMAIL.  BEST REGARDS FROM THE SUNSHINE STATE.  S/S  P.J. STAGER (DOT NUMBER: CC60  TIRESIZE: P215/70R15)

I UNDERSTAND THAT THERE WAS A RECALL ON MY VEHICLE FOR A FAULTY IGNITION SWITCH. I JUST FOUND OUT YESTERDAY ABOUT IT. I WAS NEVER NOTIFIED IN REFERENCE TO THE RECALL. IT WASN'T UNTIL THE SWITCH SHORTED OUT MY RADIO WHICH I CAN NOT REPLACE UNTIL THE SWITCH IS REPLACED. THE FORD COMPANY SAID THAT THE RECALL WAS COMPLETE. I DON'T KNOW HOW IT CAN BE COMPLETE WHEN MY CAR WAS NEVER DONE.  I HAVE A FAULTY IGNITION SWITCH THAT IS SUPPLYING SHORTS THROUGH MY WIRING HARNESS THAT CONNECTS TO THE RADIO.  I HAVE CHECKED IT BY TESTING THE POWER TO THE WIRING HARNESS (IGNITION/ACCESSORY) AND SOMETIMES IT HAS POWER AND THEN SOMETIMES IT DOESN'T. I HAVE NEVER HEARD OF A RECALL THE IS COMPLETED WHEN MINE WAS NEVER DONE.  WHAT CAN I DO SINCE IT WAS THE IGNITION SWITCH THAT CAUSED THE BURNED OUT RADIO AND ALMOST A FIRE IN MY VEHICLE?*AK

THE TWO FRONT TIRES FAILED AFTER APPROXIMATELY 23,000 MILES OF WEAR.  THE LEFT FRONT WAS WORN THROUGH ONE SET OF STEEL BELTS FOR APPROXIMATELY 1/5 OF THE TIRE CIRCUMFERENCE.  THE LEFT FRONT WAS WORN THROUGH THE TREAD  FOR APPROIMATELY 1/5 OF THE TIRE CIRCUMEFERENCE.  BOTH AREAS OF ABNORMAL WEAR WERE ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE TIRES WHEN LOOKING FORWARD FROM THE DRIVERS SEAT.   DIGITAL PHOTOS ARE AVAILABLE FO THE FAILED TIRES.  THE TIRES WERE BALANCED AND THE FRONT END WAS REALIGNED WHEN THE TIRES WERE INSTALLED.  THE VEHICLE IS MAINTAINED IN A GOOD STATE OF REPAIR AND IS NOT SUBJECT TO ABUSE.  THE FAILED TIRES WERE REPLACED ON A PRO-RATED BASIS AT THE PINT OF PURCHASE.  THE FRONT END WAS ALSO RELAIGNED.  UNFORTUNATELY, I WAS NOT PROVIDED WITH ANY QUANTITATIVE INFORMATION ON THIS FRONT END ALIGNMENT SO CAN ONLY CONCLUDE THAT NO UNUSUAL OR ABNORMAL CONDITIONS EXISTED.  THE ORIGNAL SYMPTOM WAS AN INCREASING LEVEL OF VEHICLE VIBRATION PRIMARILY WHEN DECELERATING THROUGH 30 MPH.    THE FOLLOWING ADDTIONAL INFORMATION WAS LOCATED ON THE INSIDE OR BLACKWALL SIDE OF THE TIRES:  85288 IN RAISED NUMBERS AND 8H2298 IN A RECESSED BOX WITH ROUNDED CORNERS.   IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS OR REQUIRE ADDTIONAL INFORMATION OR COPIES OF THE PHOTOS OF THE FAILED TIRES, PLEASE CONTACT ME.  BEST REGARDS FROM THE SUNSHINE STAE.  S/S P>J> STAGER.  *AK( DOT NUMBER: CC60 TIRE SIZE: P215/70R15 )

ATTORNEY PETITION TO INVESTIGATE SUDDEN ACCELERATION OF 1988 LINCOLN TOWN CAR, WHICH ACCELERATED AND RESULTED IN DEATH OF ONE CHILD AND AMPUTATION OF OTHER CHILD. (ATTORNEY FOR CONSUMER). MJS
ALTERNATOR FAILED REPLACED THREE TIMES.  YH
VEHICLE WAS PARKED AND  ELECTRICAL  WIRING CAUGHT ON FIRE.HOOD/STEERING WHEEL/SEATS AND REAR TWO TIRES MELTED.  FIRE DEPARTMENT CAME OUT AND PUT THE FIRE OUT. *AK

THE CAR WAS LEFT AT THE REPAIR FACILITY FOR ENGINE REPAIR AND TO REMAIN OVERNIGHT.  THE NEXT MORNING, ON JUNE 30, THE OWNER OF THE REPAIR FACILITY SMELLED A STRONG ODOR OF GASOLINE FUMES WHEN HE ENTERED THE BUILDING.  HE IMMEDIATELY DISCOVERED THE GAS TANK HAD BEEN LEAKING AND OVERNIGHT AND WAS CONTINUOUSLY LEAKING "LIKE A FAUCET" .  THE WHOLE BUILDING WAS FILLED WITH GAS FUMES.  HIS FIRST CONCERN WAS THE CHANCE OF AN EXPLOSION SO HE DIDN'T TURN ON THE BUILDING'S INTERIOR LIGHTS.  AFTER THE TANK HAD BEEN REMOVED, MY MECHANIC SHOWED ME WHERE IT WAS RUSTED IN SEVERAL PLACES.  THE TANK IS MOUNTED IN A HOUSING WHICH BLOCKS A VIEW OF THE EXTERIOR OF THE TANK, THEREFORE, CORROSION CANNOT CANNOT BE DETECTED WHEN THE CAR IS ON A LIFT FOR ROUNTINE MAINTAINANCE AND SAFETY CHECKS.  I WAS EXTREMELY FORTUNATE THAT THIS DID NOT HAPPEN WHILE DRIVING ON THE HIGHWAY, ESPECIALLY DURING THE RECENT HEAT WAVE AND DROUGHT HERE IN MASSACHUSETTS.  ALTHOUGH THIS IS A HIGH MILEAGE CAR (90% HIGHWAY MILES), THE GAS TANK SHOULD NOT BE AFFECTED BY AGE (12 YEARS OLD) AND ESPECIALLY NOT FROM HIGH MILEAGE DRIVING.  DURING THE PAST TWELVE YEARS, I HAVE CONSISTENTLY MAINTAINED THIS CAR WITH GREAT CARE IN ORDER TO KEEP IT "LIKE NEW" FOR THE PURPOSE OF SAFETY AND UTILITY.  THE ENGINE, RADIATOR AND ALL COMPONENTS UNDER THE HOOD HAVE BEEN REPLACED AND TO TOP IT OFF, IT HAS NEW PAINT (SEVEN COATS OF CLEAR COAT).  PHYSICALLY, THE CAR IS IN PRISTINE CONDITION.  THERE APPEARS TO BE A LARGE NUMBER OF 1987, 1988, AND 1989 LINCOLN TOWN CARS CURRENTLY ON THE ROAD AND I BELIEVE THE OWNERS SHOULD BE ALERTED TO THIS POTENTIALLY DANGEROUS AND VOLATILE CONDITION.  *AK
